summary: A Caesar salad is a popular dish made with romaine lettuce, croutons, and a special dressing. The dressing includes ingredients like lemon juice, olive oil, eggs, anchovies, and Parmesan cheese. It was invented in 1924 by Caesar Cardini at his restaurant in Tijuana, Mexico, when he needed to create a new dish using limited ingredients. The salad is often prepared right at the table, just like it was originally.
title: Caesar salad
